image.altText: A historical statue cut down and vandalised.

props.synopsis: A colonial-era statue honouring a formerÂ premier who mutilated the body of an Aboriginal man is vandalised on the eve of a tribunal decision on its planned removal.

title.children: 'What goes around': Former premier's statue chopped down in the night, a day after vandals' first attempt

image.altText: A freight train stopped on the tracks with a white ute on the tracks in front of it.

props.synopsis: A man has a lucky escape after jumping out of his car before it is hit by a train at Devonport, in the state's north-west.

title.children: Man jumps from car before train smashes into it at Tasmanian level crossing

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese sit on a couch holding the budget booklets. They are smiling.

props.synopsis: Below the radio grabs and the inevitable "does my budget look inflationary in this?" back-and-forth of the budget, there thrums two fascinating and revelatory stories.

title.children: The budget sets up a climate debate that, for the first time in a long time, might actually be about something

image.altText: Jim Chalmers holds a copy of the 2024-25 budget outside of Parliament House

props.synopsis: The federal budget has revealed every household will be receiving a $300 energy discount.

title.children: The $3.5 billion plan for energy bill relief labelled 'ridiculous' and a 'bandaid' by independent, Greens

image.altText: a drone photo taken above streets with dark roofed houses

props.synopsis: The Albanese government dedicated a special chapter in its budget to Australia's housing crisis, and it used these graphs to illustrate the problem.

title.children: Australia's housing crisis in 10 graphs, from the federal budget

image.altText: Collage of scrabble letters W + L with blue and red backgrounds and icon illustrations.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has handed down the government's third budget. Have a look at what's new â and what's in it for you.

title.children: These are the winners and losers in this year's budget

image.altText: A women with blonde hair tied back into a ponytail looks towards the camera.

props.synopsis: Six deaths that occurred inside a major Tasmanian hospital will now be re-examined by the state coroner â with a nurse and midwife instrumental in bringing on the investigation asking: "Why does it take until nurses speak up, for there to be truth, justice, and accountability?"

title.children: Nurse welcomes investigation into six deaths at major Tasmanian hospital

image.altText: A yellow house with green roof and deck in front.

props.synopsis: The owner of a house where 40 workers from Vanuatu were living dismisses concerns of fire risk at the property, where Tasmanian authorities found 56 beds and conditions described as "poor and unsafe".

title.children: Fire risk 'very significant' in overcrowded Tasmanian house with 40 seasonal workers crammed inside

image.altText: Jim gestures as he speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: The 2024 Federal Budget has been handed down, and the government is hitting the airwaves to sell it to the public. Follow live.

title.children: 'Helping turn the tide for Australians under pressure': Treasurer delivers post-budget Press Club speech

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Are they going to build homeless shelters?'
Budget is a 'bandaid on a bullet wound' says Peter Dutton
What deficits and increased spending will mean for rates

image.altText: A close shot of Dutton's face, partially lit.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says the Coalition will support new budget measures â energy relief for every household, Commonwealth rent relief, cheaper medicines and HECS debt help.

title.children: Opposition to support energy bill relief and other big-ticket budget items

image.altText: Hands holding a power bill

props.synopsis: Last night's budget had a few measures that could put extra money in your pocket.Â But don't expect a cheque in the mail or a bonus payment directly into your bank account.Â

title.children: How you'll get the $300 energy rebate promised in last night's budget

image.altText: A woman with curly hair, carrying her dog, standing outside a colourfully-decorated red yurt.

props.synopsis: When renting became unaffordable, single mum Beck Meyers started camping on a bush block she bought with a friend. Now, she, her children, and her friend are at risk of being evicted into homelessness by their local council.Â

title.children: 'Bureaucracy gone mad': Family told to leave their own land

image.altText: A man sits on the bed of an MRI machine looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Richard Scolyer, who has treated his stage four brain cancer using his own research, has announced his latest scans show no new cancer growth one year after his initial diagnosis.Â

title.children: Australian of the Year brain cancer free one year on from diagnosis

image.altText: Planet WASP-193b V2

props.synopsis: The new planet, named WASP-193b, appears to dwarf Jupiter in size, yet researchers found it's the second-lightest planet discovered to date.

title.children: Scientists discover 'super fluffy' planet with the same density as fairy floss

image.altText: Snowtown accomplice Mark Haydon in a cap and jumper.

props.synopsis: Last-minute measures to monitor and control Snowtown accomplice Mark Ray Haydon have been imposed days before the 65-year-old's sentence is set to end and he is released into the community.

title.children: Snowtown accomplice has last-minute control measures imposed by court

image.altText: Twin sisters standing back to back smiling at the camera in very colourful tops

props.synopsis: Georgia Laurie repeatedly hit the reptile in the nose to save her sister while swimming in a river in Mexico in 2021.

title.children: Twin who punched crocodile to save her sister receives King's medal for bravery

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou wears a hooded coat in the rain

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou railed against a philosophy at Tottenham that saw portions of home support actively willing Spurs to lose against Manchester City to help deny arch-rivals Arsenal the Premier League title. It's highlighted to him how hard a job he has to turn Tottenham into winners.

title.children: Spurs fans wanted to lose to Manchester City, and Ange was furious about it

image.altText: A manÂ looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The March quarter Wage Price Index shows wages are still rising but the pace is slowing. The Australian share market is up a day after the federal budget revealed cost-of-living relief and $22.7 billion of long-term spending on clean energy and strategic industries. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Wage rises slow, the ASX is up, and Anglo American to sell Queensland coal mines

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wages are rising, but the pace isn't even
What do economists think about the budget?

image.altText: A photo graphic of a blurred-out young male on a mobile phone sitting in front of a laptop.

props.synopsis: For up to four weeks, Alex and his family received up to 50 food deliveries a day after his address was shared by someone he had an argument with while playing Call of Duty online. Here's what to do if, like Alex, you've been doxxed.

title.children: Young people share their experiences of being doxxed â from 50 food deliveries a day to being 'terrified'

image.altText: A man wearing a mask walks out of a GameStop store.

props.synopsis: GameStop and AMC Entertainment are again capturing retail investors' attention, reminiscent of the meme stock frenzy that gripped Wall Street three years ago. Here's why.Â

title.children: Meme stocks are roaring again. This time it may be different

image.altText: Pris with a mic

props.synopsis: Priscilla Oberreiner had big dreams of adventure when she arrived in Australia as a young backpacker, but she never imagined winning one of the country's most celebrated horsemanship challenges.

title.children: Priscilla, queen of the horses: How a Dutch backpacker became an outback drover and award-winning trainer

image.altText: Juamana holding up a peace sign in Egypt.

props.synopsis: Jo Jo and her family endured a harrowing journey to escape Gaza just in time. But their relief at finding safety in Australia is bittersweet as tens of thousands more remained trapped in the territory with nowhere to go.

title.children: When JoJo's family finally landed in Sydney it was a celebration â then reality quickly set in

image.altText: A young woman wearing a military uniform smiles at another person in uniform, who can only be seen from behind.

props.synopsis: Denmark is planning to expand its national service program and make it mandatory for women. While the issue is politically contentious, Russia's invasion of Ukraine is raging nearby and many are keen to sign up.

title.children: As the threat of war in Europe looms, this country has begun drafting young women into service

image.altText: A sketch of Michael Cohen testifying in court. He is wearing a blue suit. He has short, grey hair.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's lawyers have tried to use Michael Cohen's words against him, grilling him about insulting social media posts and television appearances to try to undermine his testimony that the former president authorised a hush money payment to a porn star.

title.children: 'I violated my moral compass': Trump's estranged lawyer tells court he regrets lying for him

image.altText: Composite of two photos. One is a portrait of Mohamed Amra. The second photo is of a gunman wearing a balaklava.

props.synopsis: French police are hunting for a group of gunmen who killed two prison officers in an ambush on a prison van that freed a convict linked to gangland drug killings known as "The Fly".

title.children: Major manhunt underway after gunmen ambush French prison van to free drug dealer named 'The Fly'

image.altText: Senior-aged couple standing next to each other while they wait to cross the road in Brisbane's CBD.

props.synopsis: The government says extending the freeze on social security deeming ratesÂ will help 450,000 pensioners. But that's only going to benefit pensioners who get income from deemed financial investments.Â

title.children: Here's what's in the budget for age pensioners

image.altText: a screen shows a calculator that can assist people to understand how tax cuts will affect them.

props.synopsis: The revisions to the stage 3 tax cuts have now passed parliament and will come into effect on July 1. See how much you're set to save under the changes.

title.children: Stage 3 tax cut changes come into effect on July 1. Use our calculator to see how much you'll save

image.altText: Collage of Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese in black and white, with map of Australia in background.

props.synopsis: This federal budget doesn't read like one where the cabinet put a list together of disgruntled people to appease âÂ instead, it acknowledges the government is facing a mountain of problems that cannot be solved any time soon.

title.children: Much of Chalmers's success will rest on just one budget measure that economists will hate

image.altText: A pit head is seen at the Tumela platinum mine in front of a sunset.

props.synopsis: Anglo AmericanÂ owns five mines in Queensland's Bowen Basin â Moranbah North, Capcoal, Foxleigh, Dawson and Callide.

title.children: Anglo American to sell all Australian coal mines after rejecting BHP takeover bid

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: A daughter of slain camper Carol Clay could be among those to give evidence in the murder trial of her mother's alleged killer Greg Lynn, as the ex-pilot's murder trial enters its second day of evidence.

title.children: Witnesses to be called as High Country double murder trial enters second day of evidence

image.altText: A large army truck crashed into a petrol station

props.synopsis: A large army truck has caused serious damage after driving into the roof of a Bruce Highway petrol station on the way to a military exercise.

title.children: Army truck ploughs into service station in North Queensland

image.altText: NRL player David Fifita, with ball in hand, approaches a defender

props.synopsis: David Fifita has sensationally announced he has signed with the Gold Coast Titans, a week after he told them he would leave the club at the end of the season.

title.children: Fifita re-signs with Titans after Roosters pull contract offer

image.altText: Black and white image of monoplane, and man fixing the front of the aircraft.

props.synopsis: The fear of losing his sweetheart inspired Arthur Butler to make a record-breaking flight from England to Australia in 1931. Now his grandson is fighting to preserve his legacy in Tooraweenah, the town his flight made famous.

title.children: How the threat of a broken heart and a night in an Italian jail made aviation history

image.altText: A black and white photograph of a woman laughing while holding a book.

props.synopsis: Munro was the first lifelong Canadian to win the Nobel and the first recipient cited exclusively for short fiction.

title.children: Alice Munro, Canadian Nobel Prize-winning author, dead at 92

image.altText: A group of young people stand together for a photo

props.synopsis: Netiporn "Bung" Sanesangkhom was accused of insulting Thailand's monarchy and was awaiting trial when she undertook a hunger strike.

title.children: Activist accused of insulting Thai monarchy dies in prison after hunger strike
